intro: Stenandrium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy stenandrium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Stenandrium hirsutum is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
